metadata.title: Israel to place $500 million, US-funded order for Boeing aerial refuelling tankers

left: Israel will acquire two Boeing KC-46 aerial refuelling tankers in a $500 million US-funded deal, the Israeli Defense Ministry said on Wednesday it will sign the contract once approved.
Following earlier buys, the follow-on contract adds two tankers, expanding the Israeli Defense Forces' refueling fleet to six Boeing-made KC-46s.
Under US foreign military sales rules, the new KC-46s will carry additional Israeli systems adapted for the Israeli Air Force's operational requirements, the Israeli Defense Ministry said.

The addition will expand operational reach, as Amir Baram, the ministry’s Director General, said the aircraft would enhance long-range strategic capabilities and KC-46 tankers aided Israel during the June Iran war.
